data.name: Leaves
data.description:
Given a flat array of singly linked "node" objects return a tuple of the root node and a list of leaf nodes:

```
return (root, [leaf, leaf, ...])
```

For example; given a tree linked as such:

```
     0
    / \
   1   2
  / \ / \
 3  4 5  6
```

in an array of node objects:

```
[Node_1, Node_0, Node_3, Node_2, Node_6, Node_5, Node_4]
```

you would return:

```
(Node_0, [Node_3, Node_4, Node_5, Node_6])
```

The node object is generally defined as:

```
class Node:

  def __init__(self, ref_to_node_parent):
      # None for the root node only
      self.parent = ref_to_node_parent
```

(You'll notice that I provide a `solution_normalizer` method in the example test case. Use this method since the order of the leaf node array is not part of this solution)
